intro: Antidesma mindanaense, commonly known as Mindanao antidesma, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
